page.title: 01Description of Area
page.content: Situated about 10 miles south of Bristol in Green Belt land, elevation between 250 and 500ft, the area is chiefly agricultural consisting of 20 or more small farms (mainly dairy, some beef and sheep), an area of unfenced land known as Breach Hill, and many miles of narrow lanes. Almost the whole parish and the entire village of Nempnett Thrubwell is included as well as half the parish of Winford to the north and small areas of Ubley and Compton Martin to the south. There is a corner of Blagdon Lake (Yeo Reservoir) to the S.W. and a similar area of Chew Valley Lake to the S.E, both being surronded by plantations of conifers and other trees. The whole area is criss-crossed by a maze of footpaths, not necessarily rights of way.
